we got our money's worth and then some.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sum, of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek hamōs 'somehow' and Sanskrit sama 'any, every'

encyclopedia.content: some 英文发音：[sʌm, 弱 səm, sm] 形容词a. [Z] 1.锛埿奘蚊实牡ナ问斤級某一，某个 She is playing chess with someboy. 她在和一个男孩下棋。 2.锛埿奘蚊实母词问交虿豢墒曙級某些，若干，一部分的，一些 I have somework to do this evening. 今晚我有些事要做。 Somemushrooms are poisonous. 有些蘑菇是有毒的。 There are someoranges 那里有一些橙子 3.好些，好几个，不少 He lived in Lond

entry.tran: 一些，有些(表示不确切的数量或数目)
entry.def: You use some to refer to a quantity of something or to a number of people or things, when you are not stating the quantity or number precisely.

example.ex: Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil, a chopped clove of garlic and some black pepper in a heavy saucepan...
example.tran: 将几勺橄榄油、一片切碎的蒜瓣和一些黑胡椒粉放入深平底锅里加热。

entry.tran: (表示数量或数目相当大)好些，大量
entry.def: You use some to emphasize that a quantity or number is fairly large. For example, if an activity takes some time, it takes quite a lot of time.

example.ex: The question of local government finance has been the subject of debate for some years...
example.tran: 地方政府的财政问题已经争论了好些年。

example.ex: I have discussed this topic in some detail...
example.tran: 我已经较为详细地探讨了这个话题。

entry.tran: (表示数量或数目相当小)有几分，有点儿
entry.def: You use some to emphasize that a quantity or number is fairly small. For example, if something happens to some extent, it happens a little.

example.ex: 'Isn't there some chance that William might lead a normal life?' asked Jill...
example.tran: 吉尔问：“威廉还有一线希望过上正常的生活吗？”

example.ex: All mothers share to some extent in the tension of a wedding...
example.tran: 从某种程度上说，所有的母亲在婚礼上多少都有点紧张。

entry.def: If you refer to some of the people or things in a group, you mean a few of them but not all of them. If you refer to some of a particular thing, you mean a part of it but not all of it.

example.ex: Some of the people already in work will lose their jobs...
example.tran: 一些已经工作的人将要失业。

example.ex: Remove the cover and spoon some of the sauce into a bowl...
example.tran: 打开盖子，用勺子盛些调味汁到碗里。

entry.def: If you refer to some person or thing, you are referring to that person or thing but in a vague way, without stating precisely which person or thing you mean.

example.ex: If you are worried about some aspect of your child's health, call us...
example.tran: 如果你担心孩子某方面的健康问题，请给我们打电话。

example.ex: Jim Partridge chucked himself off some bridge or other...
example.tran: 吉姆·帕特里奇从某座桥上跳了下去。

entry.def: You can use some in front of a number to indicate that it is approximate.

example.ex: I have kept birds for some 30 years...
example.tran: 我养鸟大约有 30 年了。

example.ex: He waited some 80 to 100 yards from the big pink villa...
example.tran: 他在距离那座粉红色的大别墅约 80 到 100 码的地方等候着。

entry.def: Some is used to mean to a small extent or degree.

example.ex: If Susanne is off somewhere, I'll kill time by looking around some...
example.tran: 如果苏珊不在，我就随便看看打发时间好了。
杰德说：“我有时会去参加聚会。”

entry.tran: (表示赞同或不赞同)也叫，也算；了不起的，好极的
entry.def: You can use some in front of a noun in order to express your approval or disapproval of the person or thing you are mentioning.

example.ex: She lived to be ninety-nine years old and only weighed eighty pounds but she'd raised eight kids. That was some tough woman!...
example.tran: 她活到了 99 岁的高龄，体重虽然只有 80 磅，却养了 8 个孩子。真是个了不得的女人！

example.ex: 'Some party!'—'Yep. One hell of a party.'
example.tran: “这算是哪门子的聚会！”——“就是，简直是一塌糊涂。”

means.word_mean: 1. quantifier; used with either mass nouns or plural count nouns to indicate an unspecified number or quantity;

sentences.sentence: "some man telephoned while you were out"

means.word_mean: 3. relatively many but unspecified in number;

sentences.sentence: "we did not meet again for some years"

means.word_mean: 5. relatively much but unspecified in amount or extent;
1. (of quantities) imprecise but fairly close to correct;

sentences.sentence: "I've had about all I can stand"
"20 or so people were at the party"

list.explanation: (用作单数)重要的、极好的、灵巧的人或事物(的)

example.zh: 勒鲁瓦曾经算得上是个人物。

example.en: Isn't this little gadget really some punkins?
example.zh: 这件小装置难道不灵巧吗？

list.explanation: 用武力或责骂制止他人争吵，阐明道理要他人必须去干 (某事)

example.en: Do I have to come in there and knock some heads together, or will you kids settle down?
example.zh: 非要我进来骂一通，你们这些小子才会安静下来吗？

example.en: I knocked people's heads together and got the proposal out on time.
example.zh: 我讲明了道理，才让人准时把计划搞了出来。

auth_sentence.res_content: You have to be calm in some difficult moments.

sentences.en: Some people came to see her.
Will you buy me some books?
The railway station is some distance from the village.
sentences.cn: 火车站离这个村相当远。

sentences.en: He is working at some place in the north.
He asked for money and I gave him some.
sentences.cn: 他要钱, 我给了他一些。

sentences.en: Some say yes and some say no.
sentences.cn: 有的说是, 有的说不是。

sentences.en: I'm feeling some better today, thanks.
sentences.cn: 我今天觉得稍微好些, 谢谢。

jushi.english: That was some speech you made!
He is working at some place in the north.
